title: Anyone else still live with parents?

replies.body:
Doesn't get any easier in college.

**Furious knocking**
**Looks up from computer**
**Knocking continues**
**Sighs**
~~Goes to see who it is~~
**Lowers volume and tries not to click loudly**
LOL, I did this so many times! "If I pretend I'm not here, they'll go away". 9 times outta 10 it was just a sorority asking for donations for something anyway lol.

Oh my god, this is so relatable.

"Hey, please come to the social event nobody cares about!"
"Okay! Thanks for letting me know for the fifteenth time!"
**slams door and keeps playing League**

Lol, for my school it was usually, "Hey, we're collecting donations for X philanthropy."
Me: "Uhm, I have like 1 clean shirt because I don't even have money for laundry...."

Lol, if someone needed me, we would text. Only time someone would come to my door for an important issues without texting me would be around food time.

Ah, the college life.

To be fair, I go to a tech school so basically everyone is gaming or studying. It's basically the school's job to drag us out by the hair and force us to talk to *people.*
Same here, but I'm heavy and intimidating, so people were afraid to drag me anywhere. Needless to say, I made about as many friends online as I did in the meatworld.

Oh how I wish I could try out dorm life..


.

.



... No I don't .__.
Why? It's fun.
I think the WiFi would make it near impossible to play League with how many people would be on it at the same time. Then there is always the chance of really crappy roommates.

Most dorms have ethernet hook up.

Yeah, roommates is an issue...but typically just the first year. After the first semester/year you can pick who you want to room with.

Brings me back to my Starsiege: Tribes days.

...I'm old and this is me now:
http://www.reactiongifs.us/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/fellow_kids_steve_buscemi.gif

> [{quoted}](name=Bark Wahlberg,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=KKRMlY55,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-12-13T19:48:12.049+0000)
>
> Brings me back to my Starsiege: Tribes days.
> 
> ...I'm old and this is me now:
> http://www.reactiongifs.us/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/fellow_kids_steve_buscemi.gif

This is literally the first time I notice the shirt just says "music band"

I'm dying. X3
You like Music Band too?!?!
Saw your reply in the red tracker and I was hoping for one of the staff to say they still live with their parents XD
STEVE BUSCEMIIIIIIIIIIIII
Wow first time I see someone acknowledge that games existence outside of anything tribes related.

When you have a job, a child, or simply being as respectful to your spouse as you should your mother, you learn to plan your time accordingly. If you're not sure you're going to have the time to finish a game, then simply do not play. You'll learn to fill that time with things that either take less time or can be paused.

My wife does not need to ask me to pause my game, not usually. If she's home, I make it clear, "hey, I'm going to be playing this game for the next allotted amount of time." and she's respectful of that because I'm respectful in return by being coincious of other rituals (I.e. dinner) or responsibilities (including taking care of her and our daughters' needs).

You do realize that there are times when you do have time and intend on using it to play a game, your parents/whatever start demanding your presence for an "emergency" that you need to be there right fucking now for and it is literally something stupid or doesn't require your attention at this moment, if at all.

Of course there's my favorite:

Let the dog out.

I can't, i am in the middle of a match>

So, pause it and let them out.

I can't, it is a multiplayer online game.

Do it anyways.

Keep in mind that they are literally sitting next to the door the dogs go out and it is my sisters fucking bitch that wants out, but my sister is to lazy to stand up and walk 2 steps to do it.
That's when I ask if I may finish what I'm doing, usually asking nicely they say yes.
Sometimes mines are like that. Other times he just plugs out my Ethernet cable. Sigh....

Parents be like

http://i.imgur.com/h5Sce.gif
Get out there and mow some lawns, then buy a WiFi card.

> [{quoted}](name=Bark Wahlberg,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=KKRMlY55,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2015-12-14T00:23:35.010+0000)
>
> Get out there and mow some lawns, then buy a WiFi card.

But then you have to play on wifi.... 

x.x

People like you are why...

I dislike "bring down the hammer on afks threads"

because sometimes being afk isn't your choice! and i'm paranoid that a harsher system would start banning people who's parents get pissed off.

Me: Do you guys need me for anything soon? If not im playing games.
Mom: Dont start a game food will be ready in 15 minutes
Me: Ok
15 minutes later
Me: How much longer until that foods done?
Mom: 15 minutes

My dad does this whenever I'm home from college. Sometimes I just get a "soon" 

Ugh.
Remember to ask her if she will defy the laws of physics again before believing her.
This happens all the fucking time for me.

YES! HOLY SHIT YES! I am SO sick of this when it's around a meal-time!

"PAUSE YOUR GAME AND COME EAT!"
"No, I can't!"
"YES YOU CAN, GET YOUR ASS OUT HERE!"
"It's an online game!"
"So what? Get your ass out here!"

- Every mealtime that I have a game running EVER. I get so sick of it.
Here's a novel thought... don't start a game close to meal time.
Or ask when will dinner be ready OR realize that it's just a game, buy a {{item:3512}}  and  {{item:3060}}  then eat food.
Yes please. So many people like to blame it on parents when it's easily avoidable.
https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-qTq21lLGOfM/Viq8g8CPknI/AAAAAAAAB9s/Fx5hFJ7RnnY/w506-h444/2015%252520-%2525201%252520%25283%2529.jpg

He later won the Noble Piece Prize and got assassinated by a concerned mother, the police killed the mom and her kids never had to get out mid game playing any online game. To this day, more and more kids are now able to finish online games in peace. You will be forever remembered Martin Luther King.
I totally lucked out with my parents, they understand how online games work, and have taken to telling me whatever it is that needs to happen an hour before hand.
*stands in the corner trying not to be completely jealous*

I played a game in the middle of the class once at the university, all 20 sumthin kids were giving me the dirty look and then one dude shouted loudly "DUDE STOP CLICKING" and then the prof looked at me and i had a poker face on xD, embarrassing yet funny moments.
I have no job, no money, and I live with my parents. on the plus side, I haven't even graduated high school yet :D
SAME, BRO!

Me: "Hey mom! I'm going to start a game. Don't get on any videos, okay?"
_15 minutes later_
Me: "Mom? My ping is spiking really badly. What's up?"
Mom: "I'm watching _So You Think You Can Dance!_" ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
Me: "Uh... Can you wait until later? Like, get on facebook or something... Just no videos."
Mom: ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
My mom understands that League is a game that can't be paused.  And THAT'S why she hates it, really.

Then again if  you have parents like mine you'll get beat just for trying to play league... 
so you have to hide under ur bed at night after stealing the laptop really late at night and if they find you... well its another fucking beating

End then ofc u get a prio que which is probably worse cuz then you have to wait another 20 mins to play a game which means u need like  60 - 80 mins man so annoying

LOL

I'm sorry that just came off sounding funny as hell. I can sort of relate though. My dad fucking hates video games of any kind so I have to wait until he's not around.

> [{quoted}](name=9kPluzZ,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=KKRMlY55,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-12-13T04:45:12.339+0000)
>
> http://global3.memecdn.com/Mom-please-understand_o_127790.jpg
> Every fucking day.

You can if it's Dota :D
... Don't make me jealous.
+1 cuz thats how it works with all 5 five members of my family
I don't anymore, but lived through it, also,  holidays are coming up and that will probably happen again.

Back when I was in college several of us played league. But some of the girls would complain that we were to loud when we played after supper. Never stopped them from coming home at 2 in the morning and destroying the place, lol.
Same.... but it was before.... Now I play the night so I'am living perilously
It's why I always make sure, my father is set and needs absolutely nothing for the nest 3 hours or so.....wish I could say the same for unprecedented relatives.
